Operation 'post-transferFunds' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The current description is mostly clear but lacks critical information for AI agent decision-making: (1) missing_output_details - no mention of what the response contains or how to interpret it; (2) missing_side_effects - no indication that this operation modifies account balances or creates transaction records. The summary is adequate and action-oriented. Enhanced description now specifies response content, explains the persistent effects on account state, and clarifies how this operation relates to other Fund API operations, improving AI agent interpretability for determining when and how to use this endpoint.

data.current_description: Transfers funds from one account to another account. Both accounts must be in the same platform, but can have different account holders. The transfer must include a transfer code, which should be determined by the platform, in compliance with local regulations.
data.description_suggestion: Transfers funds from one account to another account within the same platform. Both accounts can have different account holders. The transfer requires a transfer code determined by the platform in compliance with local regulations. Returns a TransferFundsResponse containing the transfer status and reference information. This operation modifies account balances and creates a transaction record that can be retrieved via the transaction list endpoint.
data.reasoning: The current description is mostly clear but lacks critical information for AI agent decision-making: (1) missing_output_details - no mention of what the response contains or how to interpret it; (2) missing_side_effects - no indication that this operation modifies account balances or creates transaction records. The summary is adequate and action-oriented. Enhanced description now specifies response content, explains the persistent effects on account state, and clarifies how this operation relates to other Fund API operations, improving AI agent interpretability for determining when and how to use this endpoint.

message: Operation 'post-debitAccountHolder' has semantic quality issues: missing_side_effects, missing_output_details. Description mentions webhook notification but doesn't clearly explain the asynchronous nature of the operation or what the immediate response contains. Added clarity about the two-phase response pattern (immediate response + async webhook) to help AI agents understand the operation's side effects and timing.

data.current_description:
Sends a direct debit request to an account holder's bank account. If the direct debit is successful, the funds are settled in the accounts specified in the split instructions. Adyen sends the result of the direct debit in a [`DIRECT_DEBIT_INITIATED`](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/NotificationService/latest/post/DIRECT_DEBIT_INITIATED) notification webhook.

 To learn more about direct debits, see [Top up accounts](https://docs.adyen.com/classic-platforms/top-up-accounts).
data.description_suggestion: Sends a direct debit request to an account holder's bank account to top up platform accounts. If successful, funds are settled according to split instructions. The operation returns an immediate response with the request status, and Adyen sends the final result asynchronously via a DIRECT_DEBIT_INITIATED notification webhook. Note that the actual debit settlement is asynchronous and completion should be verified through webhook notifications.
data.reasoning: Description mentions webhook notification but doesn't clearly explain the asynchronous nature of the operation or what the immediate response contains. Added clarity about the two-phase response pattern (immediate response + async webhook) to help AI agents understand the operation's side effects and timing.

message: Operation 'post-payoutAccountHolder' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original description is too brief and lacks essential details. Enhanced version specifies required inputs (account ID, amount, currency), expected outputs (transaction details, reference, status), and clarifies the asynchronous processing nature for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_summary: Pay out from an account to the account holder
data.current_description: Pays out a specified amount from an account to the bank account of account holder.
data.description_suggestion: Pays out a specified amount from a platform account to the account holder's designated bank account. Requires the account identifier, payout amount, and currency. Returns the payout transaction details including transaction reference and status. The payout is processed asynchronously; use the transaction reference to track completion.
data.reasoning: Original description is too brief and lacks essential details. Enhanced version specifies required inputs (account ID, amount, currency), expected outputs (transaction details, reference, status), and clarifies the asynchronous processing nature for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'post-refundFundsTransfer' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Description lacks clarity on required inputs (what identifier is needed to specify the transfer to refund) and outputs (what information is returned). Enhanced version specifies the transfer reference requirement and clarifies the return value for AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description: Refunds funds transferred from one account to another. Both accounts must be in the same platform, but can have different account holders.
data.description_suggestion: Refunds funds previously transferred between platform accounts. Requires the original transfer reference or transaction identifier. Both source and destination accounts must be within the same platform but can belong to different account holders. Returns the refund transaction details including the refund reference and status.
data.reasoning: Description lacks clarity on required inputs (what identifier is needed to specify the transfer to refund) and outputs (what information is returned). Enhanced version specifies the transfer reference requirement and clarifies the return value for AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'post-refundNotPaidOutTransfers' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Description explains the account-level refund logic well but lacks clarity on required inputs (which account to refund) and outputs (what is returned). Enhanced version specifies the account identifier requirement and clarifies the return value for better AI agent guidance.

data.current_summary: Refund all transactions of an account since the most recent payout
data.current_description: Refunds all the transactions of an account that have taken place since the most recent payout. This request is on a account basis (as opposed to a payment basis), so only the portion of the payment that was made to the specified account is refunded. The commissions, fees, and payments to other accounts remain in the accounts to which they were sent as designated by the original payment's split details.
data.description_suggestion: Refunds all transactions in a specified account that occurred since the most recent payout. Requires the account identifier. Operates at the account level, refunding only the portion of split payments allocated to that account; commissions, fees, and amounts sent to other accounts are not refunded. Returns the refund transaction details and the total amount refunded.
data.reasoning: Description explains the account-level refund logic well but lacks clarity on required inputs (which account to refund) and outputs (what is returned). Enhanced version specifies the account identifier requirement and clarifies the return value for better AI agent guidance.

message: Operation 'post-setupBeneficiary' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Description explains the operational logic and constraints well but lacks clarity on required inputs (which accounts to link) and outputs (what confirmation is returned). Enhanced version specifies input requirements and clarifies the return value for AI agent interpretability.

data.current_summary: Designate a beneficiary account and transfer the benefactor's current balance
data.current_description: Defines a benefactor and a beneficiary relationship between two accounts. At the time of benefactor/beneficiary setup, the funds in the benefactor account are transferred to the beneficiary account, and any further payments to the benefactor account are automatically sent to the beneficiary account. A series of benefactor/beneficiaries may not exceed four beneficiaries and may not have a cycle in it.
data.description_suggestion: Establishes a benefactor-beneficiary relationship between two accounts, automatically transferring the benefactor's current balance to the beneficiary. Requires benefactor and beneficiary account identifiers. After setup, all future payments to the benefactor account are automatically forwarded to the beneficiary account. Constraints: maximum four beneficiaries in a chain, and circular relationships are not permitted. Returns confirmation of the relationship setup and the transferred amount.
data.reasoning: Description explains the operational logic and constraints well but lacks clarity on required inputs (which accounts to link) and outputs (what confirmation is returned). Enhanced version specifies input requirements and clarifies the return value for AI agent interpretability.

Operation 'post-transferFunds' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The current description is mostly clear but lacks critical information for AI agent decision-making: (1) missing_output_details - no mention of what the response contains or how to interpret it; (2) missing_side_effects - no indication that this operation modifies account balances or creates transaction records. The summary is adequate and action-oriented. Enhanced description now specifies response content, explains the persistent effects on account state, and clarifies how this operation relates to other Fund API operations, improving AI agent interpretability for determining when and how to use this endpoint.

data.current_description: Transfers funds from one account to another account. Both accounts must be in the same platform, but can have different account holders. The transfer must include a transfer code, which should be determined by the platform, in compliance with local regulations.
data.description_suggestion: Transfers funds from one account to another account within the same platform. Both accounts can have different account holders. The transfer requires a transfer code determined by the platform in compliance with local regulations. Returns a TransferFundsResponse containing the transfer status and reference information. This operation modifies account balances and creates a transaction record that can be retrieved via the transaction list endpoint.
data.reasoning: The current description is mostly clear but lacks critical information for AI agent decision-making: (1) missing_output_details - no mention of what the response contains or how to interpret it; (2) missing_side_effects - no indication that this operation modifies account balances or creates transaction records. The summary is adequate and action-oriented. Enhanced description now specifies response content, explains the persistent effects on account state, and clarifies how this operation relates to other Fund API operations, improving AI agent interpretability for determining when and how to use this endpoint.

message: Operation 'post-debitAccountHolder' has semantic quality issues: missing_side_effects, missing_output_details. Description mentions webhook notification but doesn't clearly explain the asynchronous nature of the operation or what the immediate response contains. Added clarity about the two-phase response pattern (immediate response + async webhook) to help AI agents understand the operation's side effects and timing.

data.current_description:
Sends a direct debit request to an account holder's bank account. If the direct debit is successful, the funds are settled in the accounts specified in the split instructions. Adyen sends the result of the direct debit in a [`DIRECT_DEBIT_INITIATED`](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/NotificationService/latest/post/DIRECT_DEBIT_INITIATED) notification webhook.

 To learn more about direct debits, see [Top up accounts](https://docs.adyen.com/classic-platforms/top-up-accounts).
data.description_suggestion: Sends a direct debit request to an account holder's bank account to top up platform accounts. If successful, funds are settled according to split instructions. The operation returns an immediate response with the request status, and Adyen sends the final result asynchronously via a DIRECT_DEBIT_INITIATED notification webhook. Note that the actual debit settlement is asynchronous and completion should be verified through webhook notifications.
data.reasoning: Description mentions webhook notification but doesn't clearly explain the asynchronous nature of the operation or what the immediate response contains. Added clarity about the two-phase response pattern (immediate response + async webhook) to help AI agents understand the operation's side effects and timing.

message: Operation 'post-payoutAccountHolder' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original description is too brief and lacks essential details. Enhanced version specifies required inputs (account ID, amount, currency), expected outputs (transaction details, reference, status), and clarifies the asynchronous processing nature for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_summary: Pay out from an account to the account holder
data.current_description: Pays out a specified amount from an account to the bank account of account holder.
data.description_suggestion: Pays out a specified amount from a platform account to the account holder's designated bank account. Requires the account identifier, payout amount, and currency. Returns the payout transaction details including transaction reference and status. The payout is processed asynchronously; use the transaction reference to track completion.
data.reasoning: Original description is too brief and lacks essential details. Enhanced version specifies required inputs (account ID, amount, currency), expected outputs (transaction details, reference, status), and clarifies the asynchronous processing nature for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'post-refundFundsTransfer' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Description lacks clarity on required inputs (what identifier is needed to specify the transfer to refund) and outputs (what information is returned). Enhanced version specifies the transfer reference requirement and clarifies the return value for AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description: Refunds funds transferred from one account to another. Both accounts must be in the same platform, but can have different account holders.
data.description_suggestion: Refunds funds previously transferred between platform accounts. Requires the original transfer reference or transaction identifier. Both source and destination accounts must be within the same platform but can belong to different account holders. Returns the refund transaction details including the refund reference and status.
data.reasoning: Description lacks clarity on required inputs (what identifier is needed to specify the transfer to refund) and outputs (what information is returned). Enhanced version specifies the transfer reference requirement and clarifies the return value for AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'post-refundNotPaidOutTransfers' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Description explains the account-level refund logic well but lacks clarity on required inputs (which account to refund) and outputs (what is returned). Enhanced version specifies the account identifier requirement and clarifies the return value for better AI agent guidance.

data.current_summary: Refund all transactions of an account since the most recent payout
data.current_description: Refunds all the transactions of an account that have taken place since the most recent payout. This request is on a account basis (as opposed to a payment basis), so only the portion of the payment that was made to the specified account is refunded. The commissions, fees, and payments to other accounts remain in the accounts to which they were sent as designated by the original payment's split details.
data.description_suggestion: Refunds all transactions in a specified account that occurred since the most recent payout. Requires the account identifier. Operates at the account level, refunding only the portion of split payments allocated to that account; commissions, fees, and amounts sent to other accounts are not refunded. Returns the refund transaction details and the total amount refunded.
data.reasoning: Description explains the account-level refund logic well but lacks clarity on required inputs (which account to refund) and outputs (what is returned). Enhanced version specifies the account identifier requirement and clarifies the return value for better AI agent guidance.

message: Operation 'post-setupBeneficiary' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Description explains the relationship mechanics and constraints but lacks clarity on required inputs (which accounts to link) and outputs (what confirmation is returned). Enhanced version specifies input requirements and clarifies the return value, making it more actionable for AI agents.

data.current_summary: Designate a beneficiary account and transfer the benefactor's current balance
data.current_description: Defines a benefactor and a beneficiary relationship between two accounts. At the time of benefactor/beneficiary setup, the funds in the benefactor account are transferred to the beneficiary account, and any further payments to the benefactor account are automatically sent to the beneficiary account. A series of benefactor/beneficiaries may not exceed four beneficiaries and may not have a cycle in it.
data.description_suggestion: Establishes a benefactor-beneficiary relationship between two accounts, automatically transferring the benefactor's current balance to the beneficiary. Requires benefactor and beneficiary account identifiers. After setup, all future payments to the benefactor account are automatically forwarded to the beneficiary account. Constraints: maximum four beneficiaries in a chain, and circular relationships are not permitted. Returns confirmation of the relationship setup and the transferred amount.
data.reasoning: Description explains the relationship mechanics and constraints but lacks clarity on required inputs (which accounts to link) and outputs (what confirmation is returned). Enhanced version specifies input requirements and clarifies the return value, making it more actionable for AI agents.
